Page...2....
You are the second son of 1 of us and the only brother of 2 Assamese. Therefore, out of the love we have for you, we have the intention of passing on some property to you, and considering love as a reward, we have duly given you the property valued at Rs. 1,20,000 - 00 as per the schedule below, and we have taken possession of the said property to you today itself. From now on, you shall be the permanent and absolute owner of this settlement property and you shall enjoy it with all the full rights of donation and sale for the benefit of your children and grandchildren for a period of one month. Regarding this settlement property, no matter what disputes arise from anyone, we or our residents, with our own money, will eliminate all of them and implement this settlement deed to you without interruption. This settlement property was the ancestral property of the husband of the 1st of us, you and the father of the 2nd of us, Sahadeva, and they are enjoying it with full possession and rights, and they passed away intestate about 10 years ago without writing any documents. The settlement property as per the schedule below, which came into our possession after the said Sahadeva, and which we are enjoying full possession of till date, is undisputed property, and has not been transferred to anyone else, and is entrusted to you by this settlement deed in your name. Since there is no tax on this settlement property, no notice has been filed. We hereby declare that there are no buildings or vacant land in this settlement property. The property as per this deed does not belong to Andhra Pradesh Act No. 9/77. This property has not been assigned by the Sri Government. 1. Pinipe Kantamma Nishani

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No 3 of 2017 dated 05/Jan/2017, executed by 1. Pinipe Kanthamma 2. Pinipe Vinodh Sagar in favour of Pinipe Vidya Sagar, (whereas Donee is son of 1st donor & brother of 2nd donor) towards the property admeasuring an extent of 121.96Sq.Yds, located near by house number.3-94, comprised in survey number 43/7C situated in Rajavaram Village and Panchayath, Atreyapuram Mandal. erstwhile East Godavari District, now within the District of Konaseema, registered at Sub-Registrar Office, Atreyapuram(418) is bounded as follows: North by: 37.00 Ft Pinipe Sahadevudu Site Some, Pinipe Sangeetharao Site South by: 39.03 Ft Panchayithi Road East by: 27.07 Ft Pinipe Sangeetharao Site, House West by: 30.00 Ft Pinipe Sahadevudu House
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
